pro_critic_reviews.summary: Director Jon Watts is smart enough never to deviate from a narrow vision that he executes superbly.
Watts achieves a kind of early Coen brothers, early Tarantino feel.
The movie doesn't offer much in the way of substantial character development, but that's not a deterrent when the fun twists keep coming.
Cop Car does enough things so well for so long that to quibble with its finale feels churlish. This is a film very much worth seeing.
Despite the real, bloody stakes, Cop Car keeps a boyish sense of action and adventure through to a twist ending. You have a right to remain thrilled.
The movie culminates in a tense, protracted standoff that keeps the audience on edge for way longer than is comfortable. I mean that as a compliment.

The plot description is a good old-fashioned okey-doke, a distraction that lulls you with its absurdity so you’ll be blindsided by the lean, suspenseful and effective movie director Jon Watts delivers.
A surprisingly nasty piece of work, more reminiscent of old John Dahl thrillers from the ’90s (Red Rock West, The Last Seduction) than of "Let’s Be Cops."

Bacon can play just about anything, and he’s having a good time here as a guy not quite smart enough to keep himself out of trouble, but wily enough to try to dig himself out of it. It’s fun to watch.
It’s an extremely well-lubricated entertainment machine filled with attractive images and wall-to-wall appealing performances.

Watts demonstrates masterful control, pushing right up against the limits of what we can take (even non-parents will be rattled watching the boys mishandling loaded weapons), and yet, at every turn, the screenplay falls short of the picture’s full potential, missing opportunities that could have made this a classic.
Director Watts has a background in comedy direction, and a thin, sticky stream of exceptionally dark humor flows through the otherwise gut-churning realism of Cop Car.
The narrative derives much of its tension from the unsentimental ambivalence Jon Watts displays toward the story's two pre-teen boys.
There's no denying Watts' skill at a certain kind of desolate cat and mouse, but it's in the service of what is ultimately a somewhat heartless exercise.
The film soars early as a fantasy steeped in life and crashes into a drag of a crime drama, one ripped from the movies rather than anyone's idea of small-town Colorado.
Cop Car feels like a great short stretched into a mediocre feature.

Watts co-wrote the screenplay with Christopher D. Ford (“Robot & Frank”) and, frankly, it’s not as clever or compelling as it wants to be.... The filmmaker does deserve credit, however, for conjuring up some nicely tense cinematic moments.
The film is full of quiet little truths.
A potentially fun premise soon turns into no fun at all in Cop Car, a seriously imagination-challenged low-end action thriller.
Watts’ film is comprised of terrible coincidences, bad mustaches and a pervasive sense of desperation. It’s also wholly unable to live up to its obvious promise.
Cop Car is an instance of what happens when an airy indie filmmaker tries to “do genre” and winds up being as convincing as John Kerry putting down his demitasse and dressing up in hunting gear.

user_reviews.text: When 2 kids steal a cop car; it doesn't turn out to be as much fun as they were hoping for. When the crooked Sheriff (Kevin Bacon) comes looking for his car when he returns from dumping a body.
A film that for the most part gets what a 10 year old would do if they found an abandoned cop car.  Though I wish I knew more about the adults in this story Cop Car is worth your time.  B

This reminds me a lot of Spielberg's made for TV flick Duel. It's excellent for what it is--and that's an old fashioned drive thru action/horror movie that is very simple on the surface. It's actually very simple at its core too--no hidden political agendas--no character development at all, but it's not supposed to have any of that. It's a basic story, well acted, well shot. I wasn't looking for anything else but a good time when I decided to watch it--and it delivered in spades. Shout out to Kevin Bacon for taking the role--and performing it perfectly. Spoiler: It's about 2 little kids who steal a cop car and run from the cop they stole it from--and oh yeah--he's a murdering psychopath.
I'll watch pretty much anything with Kevin Bacon in it, and this is certainly worth an hour and a half of anyone's time in my opinion; it's just not very memorable.

Jon Watts was recently the director chosen to direct the next Spiderman movie and I had not seen one of his films before so I decided to check out this movie. I don’t really know what Marvel saw in this film that made Watts look like the right fit. There is nothing wrong with the direction in this movie it does not scream Spiderman This film is very independent and it is shot in a fairly isolated location. Watts does an excellent job dealing with the children in this film. There are plenty of movies out there that make young kids look way smarter than they actually are with all this big elaborate dialogue but this movie is the opposite. You could tell that the kids in this movie were young by their dialogue and by their actions and sadly the children do take up a little too much of the screen time. Kevin Bacon is excellent playing the sheriff in this film. Bacon looks very intimidating with his new mustache and he really played his character well. You had to wait until the end of the film before you really knew if he was a good guy or a bad guy. Cop Car is an interesting film for independent film fans but the movie is more of a thriller than an action film and it by no means a comedy either. There is not a lot of dialogue and there are lot of periods with no sounds so if you are looking for a truly exciting film this may not be your match right now. Besides the slowness the only other issue I had with the film was the third act. Cop Car seems to take the wrong path it its writing when an unexpected problem arises in the story and it seems like Watts wanted to take the path less traveled more than the path that was more interesting.

Two kids are running away from home.  They come across a police car with the keys in it.  They take it for a joy ride.  Sounds like a lot of movies.  But this police car has more to it than meets the eye.  That's what makes this movie different from the others and what keeps your interest.

The writers of this film must certainly have 10 year old boys at home, because they perfectly capture the logic and priorities of the age group (played with natural charm by James Freedson-Jackson and Hays Wellford, a RVA native). The duo stumbles across an abandoned cop car and go for a joyride. When the sheriff (Kevin Bacon) discovers his situation, he scrambles to cover his mistake. The innocent enthusiasm of the boys provides continual amusement, while provoking perilous caution from us grown-ups who better appreciate the dangers they face. The Coen Brothers' early films come to mind as the simple narrative develops into a compelling and quietly suspenseful ride.
This movie is a thriller that takes time to actually become a thriller.
Kevin Bacon is still attractive ! At the first time when you see the poster you think its another spoilt !
It's completely ridiculous and quite cheesy at times, but Kevin Bacon and his amazing energy make this wannabe- Coen Brothers film somewhat entertaining.
How stupid is this film?
Cop Car is well made and tense in some parts (especially towards the end), but all put together the film is a very, very dull and disappointing "thriller".

The was not the expectations.First and second acts of the movie was a waste and it dragged. The kids acting was terrible and execution of the movie was bad .The dialogues were so casual and antagonist was awful. On the other hand there were some redeeming points too. Kevin bacon was the best thing in the whole movie and his character arc was interesting.The cinematography was really good.The last Act was entertaining.

This is a very boring movie in my opinion, the dialogue is really **** and really nothing happens after 50 minutes into the movie.This movie is categorized as a Thriller movie, it doesn't live up to that at all. I don't get it that all these Critic reviews are saying that its good in comparison to Terminator Genisys where they're  saying that its bad and when you look at the user reviews it has a considerable good rating, the people from the '' Critic reviews '' don't know **** about movies.
A very original and refreshing plot. If you like unusual you will like this film.
In an usual day an unusual occurrence.

An excellent thriller that truly understands the essence of what 10 year old boys are like. Consistently funny, nail-biting in parts, with a great climax and featuring one of the most genuinely chilling sequences of the year, Cop Car is a real treat. The final couple of minutes felt unnecessary and the film could have further excelled through the use of a more prominent soundtrack. Regardless, this gem reminded me that Kevin Bacon really is 'the man' and that's no bad thing.
From the trailer, Cop Car looked so much more entertaining then it actually is. Sure, some parts are really good and entertaining, bur the rest of it is just boring.

One of my favorite movies of the last five or ten years!  Novel concept and great writing (both plot and dialogue)   - great acting, especially by the three leads (the two kids and Bacon); first rate soundtrack by a unknown to me rock band (usually these suck in indie movies: here the music works with the film and doesn't get in the way) - and wonderful photography.  (Spoiler alert)  A sort of Alfred Hitchcock cum Stephen King approach - two young boys out walking out in the boonies to the local stream stumble across a seemingly abandoned cop car, and eventually take it out for a joyride.  But it wasn't abandoned - evil Sheriff Kevin Bacon had temporarily left it while trying to dispose of a body, but ran into difficulties with the disposal, so got delayed, tired out, took a cigarette break, then slowly walks back to his cop car to get the second body he needs to get rid of .... and the look on his face when he sees his cop car isn't there is a priceless piece of acting (and filming) ....
Kevin Bacon is awesome but not one of his best films I must say. But it's quirky enough to make you laugh at times.

What was with the ending. they left off so much at the end, wouldve been nice to see what happened to the boy, but hopefully there will be a sequel to Cop Car. in my opinion, why make a movie at all if your not going to end it with a resolution and leave it off with the biggest cliffhanger ever. all and all, good movie up till the end, had alot of suspense.
